metadata.title: CVE-2020-28030 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
In Wireshark 3.2.0 to 3.2.7, the GQUIC dissector could crash. This wasaddressed in epan/dissectors/packet-gquic.c by correcting theimplementation of offset advancement.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-28030` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 3.2.8-0.1
libwireshark15 - 3.2.8-0.1
libwiretap12 - 3.2.8-0.1
libwsutil13 - 3.2.8-0.1
tshark - 3.2.8-0.1
wireshark - 3.2.8-0.1
wireshark-common - 3.2.8-0.1
wireshark-gtk - 3.2.8-0.1
wireshark-qt - 3.2.8-0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.8-0.1').
